Key Match Events: Kane Williamson and Daryl Mitchell led New Zealand to an 8-wicket victory against Bangladesh.
New Zealand maintains its dominance in the ICC World Cup 2023 with this third consecutive win.
Lockie Ferguson dismissed Shakib Al Hasan, Mushfiqur Rahim, and Towhid Hridoy, derailing Bangladesh's batting.
Daryl Mitchell scored 89 runs and finished the innings in style with a stylish six.
Post-Match Reflections: New Zealand skipper Kane Williamson and Daryl Mitchell led the team to their third consecutive win in the ICC World Cup 2023.
Bangladesh needs to convert chances into wickets and increase pressure, especially against the new batter Daryl Mitchell.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Mustafizur Rahman dismissed opener Rachin Ravindra early to put the batters under pressure.
Devon Conway and skipper Kane Williamson treaded a cautious path in the initial stages of the chase.
Bangladesh batter Mahmudullah provided crucial runs at the end of the innings.
Lockie Ferguson clinched 3 wickets, Trent Boult and Matt Henry got two wickets each, while Glenn Phillips and Mitchell Santner had one wicket each.
